channel.title: Server Status Page
channel.description:
This guide will teach you how to make a fully functional server status page. You can submit new servers, etc, etc.
An example is here: http://rspsdev.0fees.net/status/.
Go into your host, and make a mysql database. Remember your mysql user, pass, dbname, etc.
Now download this:
http://www.mediafire.com/?cww3ydyhlam
Open up connect.php, and fill in all the mysql info.
[code] <?php $host = "Server (usually localhost)"; $user = "username"; $pass = "pass"; $db = "dbname"; $conn = mysql_connect($host, $user, $pass) or die(mysql_error()); mysql_select_db($db, $conn); ?>[/code]
After that, upload everything in the file to your host.
When it is done, through phpmyadmin, open up your database.
Once you are inside of it, click the "sql button" at the top of phpmyadmin.
A big white box will popup.
Go to the files you downloaded, and copy everything that's inside of "query.sql."
Paste it in the big white box, and press go. Now go to your website, and it should work!

item.title: Server Status Page
item.dc:creator: @stormcutter stormcutter
item.description:
@stormcutter wrote:

Just a base, but has cool features such as signatures and the more views your server gets, the higher the server goes up in the list.

Read full topic

@stormcutter wrote:

This guide will teach you how to make a fully functional server status page. You can submit new servers, etc, etc.

<?php $host = "Server (usually localhost)"; $user = "username"; $pass = "pass"; $db = "dbname"; $conn = mysql_connect($host, $user, $pass) or die(mysql_error()); mysql_select_db($db, $conn); ?>[/code]
